meanings.definition: To strike or propel with the foot
meanings.sent1: He kicked the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: She kicked the door to open it.
meanings.sent3: The cat kicked the toy mouse around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The wind kicked up the fallen leaves in swirls.
meanings.sent5: The dancer kicked her leg high in the air during the performance.

meanings.definition: To move or push with force
meanings.sent1: The horse kicked its legs to run faster.
meanings.sent2: He kicked the car to get it started.
meanings.sent3: The child kicked the swing higher and higher.
meanings.sent4: The storm kicked the waves against the shore.
meanings.sent5: She kicked the rock out of the way with determination.

meanings.sent1: The movie suddenly kicked off with an exciting scene.
meanings.sent2: The meeting kicked out sooner than expected.
meanings.sent3: His plan to surprise her kicked in perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The engine kicked in just in time to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The alarm kicked on, waking everyone up in a rush.
